de.fhpotsdam.io.csv
Class CsvP5

java.lang.Object
  de.fhpotsdam.io.csv.CsvP5

public class CsvP5
extends Object

CsvP5 Reading CSV(Character Separated Values) files. Inspired by Ben Fry's Visualizing Data Book.

Author:
Tim Pulver, Paul Vollmer
+Example
/**
 * csvP5simple
 *
 * csvP5 http://www.github.com/subtub/csvP5
 */

import de.fhpotsdam.io.csv.*;

CsvP5 csv;


void setup() {
  size(500, 500);
  
  csv = new CsvP5(this, "sample.csv");
  csv.load();
  println("csv total columns   =   " + csv.getTotalColumns());
  println("csv total rows      =   " + csv.getTotalRows());
  
  PFont font = createFont("", 12);
  textFont(font);
}


void draw() {
  background(255);
  
  for(int col=0; col

Field Detail

writer

public CsvP5Writer writer
Constructor Detail

CsvP5

public CsvP5(PApplet p,
             String filename)
Constructor for CsvP5.

Parameters:
p - Use "this" from within your Processing main sketch
filename - Filename of a csv-file in your data-folder e.g. "awesome_data.csv"
Method Detail

version

public static String version()
Return the version of the library.

Returns:
String

load

public void load()
Resets the processing-flags and starts the actual CSV-processing. All functions like setSeparator() or setComment() must be called before calling load()!

hasColumnHeaders

public void hasColumnHeaders(boolean b)
Has to be called if the first row of your CSV-file (on top) contains headers. Default is no column headers (false).

Parameters:
b - True, if is has column headers, false otherwise

hasRowHeaders

public void hasRowHeaders(boolean b)
Has to be called if the first column of your CSV-file (left) contains headers. Default is no row headers (false).

Parameters:
b - True, if is has row headers, false otherwise

hasQuotationMarks

public void hasQuotationMarks(boolean b)

isComplete

public boolean isComplete()
This is an indicator if loading the CSV-file went smooth. If it happened, that the number of the separator char/string in every row differs, this will return false. There is no check for holes, so parsing a row like "data,,data,data" will be fine and just contain a blank element.

Returns:
true, if there were no problems parsing the file.

getFirstIncompleteRowIndex

public int getFirstIncompleteRowIndex()
If isComplete() returns false, which means, there were errors parsing the CSV-file, this returns the row index of the CSV-file, which can be useful if you search for "bad spots" in the CSV-file and need to fix them manually.

Returns:
The index of the first problematic row, note that index begins at 0, line numbers of most text editors start at 1.

getTotalRows

public int getTotalRows()
Returns the number of rows. If the document contains row headers and hasRowHeaders(boolean) has been called with true before CSV-import, this will not contain the header row.

Returns:
rowCount number of rows (without header row)

getTotalColumns

public int getTotalColumns()
Returns the number of columns.

Returns:
columnCount Number of columns

getColumnIndex

public int getColumnIndex(String name)
Returns a column index by its name, returns -1 if no column has been found. This can be used to find out a column index of a certain CSV-headline. Note, that this does not take care of the fact, that there can be more than one headlines with the same name.

Parameters:
name - name of the column
Returns:
integer index value of the column

getColumnHeader

public String getColumnHeader(int column)
Returns the name of a headline. To get the first headline, pass 0.

Parameters:
column - the Column number, which name you want to know
Returns:
String The column name (headline)

getColumnMax

public float getColumnMax(int columnIndex)
Returns the biggest value within one column as float

Parameters:
columnIndex - Index of the column (headlines do not count)
Returns:
biggest value, -1 if column was not found

getColumnMax

public float getColumnMax(String columnName)
Returns the biggest value within one column as float

Parameters:
columnName - header name of the column
Returns:
biggest value, -1 if column was not found

                          int startIndex,
                          int endIndex)
Returns the biggest value within one column as float

Parameters:

Returns:
biggest value, -1 if column was not found

getColumnMax

                          int startIndex,
                          int endIndex)
Returns the biggest value within [startIndex..endIndex-1] of one column as float

Parameters:
columnName - header name of the column
Returns:
biggest value, -1 if column was not found

columnIndex - Column number
